text: Hello team! I got the impression that the "sweep" option to automatically move funds from the validator to the wallet, is only available in Kubernetes-based deployments, not on Docker Compose. Am I right?  If not, where can I some info regarding how to configure this on Docker based deployment?

elements.text: Hello team! I got the impression that the "sweep" option to automatically move funds from the validator to the wallet, is only available in Kubernetes-based deployments, not on Docker Compose. Am I right?  If not, where can I some info regarding how to configure this on Docker based deployment?

text: could be done with docker compose but more complicated

elements.text: For docker compose you would need to set it through additional_config env vars

text:
We are using docker-compose method to deploy on MainNet. All containers are healthy but when we try to login with OAuth2, we get an error:
error=access_denied&error_description=Service%20not%20found%3A%20https%3A%2F%<http://2Fvalidator.example.com|2Fvalidator.example.com><http://wallet.validator.elkcapitalmarkets.com/?error=access_denied&error_description=Service%20not%20found%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fvalidator.example.com&state=7a99ae6ab1ca4ef0b33e1cc33ad0fd10|&state=7a99ae6ab1ca4ef0b33e1cc33ad0fd10>

Is <http://validator.example.com|validator.example.com> a valid audience for the validator backend API or is that just for DevNet?

2Fvalidator.example.com
&state=7a99ae6ab1ca4ef0b33e1cc33ad0fd10

text:
We might have experienced something similar, you probably skipped <https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_helm.html#:~:text=(Optional)%20If%20you,com/api.|this> step in the Auth configuration process.
> 3. (Optional) If you want to configure a different audience to your APIs, you can do so by creating new Auth0 APIs with an identifier set to the audience of your choice. For example,
> Create another API by setting name to Validator App API, set identifier for the Validator backend app e.g. <https://validator.example.com/api>.
You might have set your validator auth audience to the default `"<https://validator.example.com/api>"`, but you didn’t create the `Validator App API`. Create the API and try again.

elements.text: We might have experienced something similar, you probably skipped
this
step in the Auth configuration process.

3. (Optional) If you want to configure a different audience to your APIs, you can do so by creating new Auth0 APIs with an identifier set to the audience of your choice. For example,
Create another API by setting name to Validator App API, set identifier for the Validator backend app e.g.
You might have set your validator auth audience to the default
, but you didn’t create the
Validator App API
. Create the API and try again.

text:
So there's a possibility that there's not enough memory for the participant pod? Currently we didn't set any limit resource and using default value from the participant chart:
```resources:
  limits:
    cpu: "4"
    memory: "32Gi"
  requests:
    cpu: "1"
    memory: "16Gi"```

text: We just received a PD alert for testnet that there has been no new records ingested in an abnormally long time (almost 2 hours, derived from `splice_store_last_ingested_record_time_ms`). Not sure if this means there’s something up with the network or something up with our deployment. No longs indicating any errors.

text:
Hi team.
I'm encountering an issue with my devnet validator node deployment using version *0.4.5*.
After starting the validator, the container status stays in `"starting"` and eventually becomes `"unhealthy"`.
```INFO: SCAN address not provided, deriving it from the sponsor SV address: <https://scan.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>
INFO: Using version 0.4.5

...

[+] Running 6/7
 ✔ Network splice-validator_splice_validator      Created                                                                                                                                                                                                                0.0s
 ✔ Volume "splice-validator_domain-upgrade-dump"  Created                                                                                                                                                                                                                0.0s
 ✔ Container splice-validator-wallet-web-ui-1     Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                                               37.1s
 ✔ Container splice-validator-ans-web-ui-1        Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                                               37.1s
 ⠼ Container splice-validator-validator-1         Waiting                                                                                                                                                                                                               94.7s
 ✔ Container splice-validator-participant-1       Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                                               22.6s
 ✔ Container splice-validator-nginx-1             Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                                                6.1s
container splice-validator-validator-1 is unhealthy```
To investigate, I ran this:
```sudo docker inspect splice-validator-validator-1 | grep -A 10 Healthcheck```
It returned:
```"Healthcheck": {
  "Test": [
    "CMD-SHELL",
    "curl -f <http://localhost:5003/api/validator/readyz> || exit 1"
  ],
  ...
}```
However, when I exec into the container and run:
```curl <http://localhost:5003/api/validator/readyz>```
I get:
```curl: (7) Failed to connect to localhost port 5003: Connection refused```
This seems to suggest that the healthcheck is failing because the `/readyz` endpoint doesn't exist in version *0.4.5*.
Could you please confirm whether I should upgrade to *0.4.7* where this endpoint is available?
 I haven't seen a public announcement yet so I wanted to check before proceeding.
Thanks in advance.

done
